alert.note: Alert for Buffalo; Dunn; Pepin (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 21 at 10:47AM CDT until April 28 at 4:00AM CDT by NWS Minneapolis
info.description: ...Forecast flooding changed from Minor to Moderate severity and increased in duration for the following rivers in Wisconsin... Chippewa River at Durand affecting Dunn, Buffalo and Pepin Counties. .Widespread flooding continues on area rivers as additional rainfall from today will keep river flows increased. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY FRIDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Chippewa River at Durand. * WHEN...Until early Friday morning. * IMPACTS...At 16.5 feet, Highway 10 on the north approach to the bridge across the Chippewa River may flood. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 900 AM CDT Friday, the stage was 14.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 900 AM CDT Friday was 14.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 16.0 feet Sunday afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage late Thursday morning. - Flood stage is 13.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 16.0 feet on 06/01/1942. &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
